utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: Who are you? What are you doing? Get out of here! Mom!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Lue? Lue? You okay? Okay, honey. Calm down. It's all right. You're just having another bad dream.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: I can't breathe!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Yes, you can. You're fine. Just relax. Just take slow, deep breaths. Nice and easy. There's nothing to be afraid of.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: I'm… trying… but I can't!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Relax. Slow, deep breaths.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: I… can't.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Lue? Oh, my God. Lue? Lue, wake up! Wake up, Lue! Come on! Lue!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Been paging you for over two hours.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I must've been in the shower. Then I had to moisturize.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Eight-year-old boy was brought into the ER last night with acute respiratory distress. No history of — — no histories of asthma or allergies, and his chest X-ray's clear.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Actually, I had to moisturize twice. Dominika made oysters Rockefeller last night.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Kid's been having night terrors. Woke up in the middle of one in full respiratory arrest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stress induced panic attack. Tell the parents to lay off the grades. The world needs fry cooks too.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Does great in school. The parents are divorced, but it was amicable. And the dad's moved out of state.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you seen Wilson around?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The dreams are about an ugly, old hag trying to strangle him. The family's Hmong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: SUNDS — sudden unexpected nocturnal death syndrome, aka BS name for “no one's figured out why they died.” Over 100 in the early '80s. Only male. Only Hmong. Healthy right up until the moment they died in their sleep.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What was he dreaming about?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It doesn't matter. It's a dream. It doesn't mean anything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If the nightmare's scary enough, meaningful or not, it could cause a catecholamine surge and ventricular fibrillation. An ancient demon called a Dab was sitting on him, strangling him. I think that qualifies.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Except in the rational part of the file, where it says his EKG's within normal limits. It's not his heart.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What about obstructive sleep apnea?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sleep apnea wouldn't have caused breathing problems after he woke up. What did you dream of?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I never remember my dreams.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But you're certain that they're insignificant. Defensively so.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I was defending science.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were defensively defending science.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Lung damage from inhaled toxins could keep causing problems after he woke up.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Or an upper respiratory infection.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, Chase and Park, start IV antibiotics for pneumonia. Taub and Adams, go check the home for toxins.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Could I go with Taub? It was my idea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right… 'cause for a moment there, I thought you were uncomfortable around Chase because you'd had a nocturnal Australian. You can go with whoever you want. But all of you, read all of these files.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Do you believe a spirit could be hurting your son?

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: No, of course not.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because if he's been taught to believe that, it is possible for the fear alone to affect heart function.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I'm an engineer. I know illnesses aren't caused by evil spirits.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to, I just… had to check.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Anything else you need to check?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I had a dream.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House… we can talk later.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Relax, I'm a doctor. Your spectacular breasts mean nothing to me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: House… House!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Later.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I had sex with Dominika.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: In a dream?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It wasn't literally sex. Technically, it was flossing. You know, teeth, testicles. I think the symbolism is pretty clear.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: “Later” just changed to “never.”

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll tell you what would be weirder, if you didn't dream about having sex with Chase.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Have you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. But I've dreamed about having sex with a lot of people I work with, and it didn't freak me out.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: That's different.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: 'Cause you've actually had sex with a lot of people at work, and that hasn't freaked you out.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good point. So you're worried about what it means?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm not worried. It means nothing. It means something, doesn't it? I work with him. I can't want to sleep with him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Maybe Chase just represents work. You're just falling in love with your job.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It has been very satisfying lately.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You smell that?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yeah. Smells like wet dog.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's mold.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's not mold.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's definitely mold. I don't see any sign of water damage.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Holy crap.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It looked like a slaughterhouse.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I don't know what you're talking about. It was clean when we left.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're telling us some random person broke into your house to dismember a pig in your son's bedroom?

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: A pig? My father-in-law.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: What you should have done weeks ago, when the dreams started. I'm saving Lue.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: He's coding! Need a doctor in here!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: V-tach. No pulse.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Oh, my God!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Push 1 milligram EPI!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Paddles. Charge to 50.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Charging!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Baby…

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Still V-tach!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Charge to 100!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Clear! Charging—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Wait! Normal sinus rhythm.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Oh, God!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's stable, but we've obviously got a second symptom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, kid in V-tach. Tell me about the luau in his bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's a traditional Hmong ceremony that's supposed to call back the kid's soul.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hasn't he heard of Star-69?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There's more. The reason grandpa thinks the kid's soul is stolen is because he's convinced his son, the kid's father, had his stolen as well. He beat his boss to death. The dad didn't move away. He's in prison.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: PTSD could definitely cause breathing problems—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It's not PTSD.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Even if the kid wasn't there, just hearing what the dad did—

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: But he hasn't. It happened when he was two, and all he's ever been told is that his parents divorced and his dad moved away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The heart thing indicates a malignant arrhythmia. He needs an E.P. study.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How many of the other files showed malignant arrhythmias?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: None, but—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Forget the E.P.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about acute pericarditis? Explains the dyspnea.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How many of the other files—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's exacerbated by lying supine, so the symptoms would get worse when he goes to sleep. Just like all 100 of the others.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do an echo to check the pericardium. See if you can find any cardioactive toxins in the home samples.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Can I just say that I very much enjoy my job?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, no, please. No need to apologize for your earlier behavior. Floss was mint probably because of this green G-string she hangs up to dry in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My watch must have stopped. Apparently it's already “never.”

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You might want to forward your calls. You do not want the Reader's Digest version on this. There was a very tight hygienist's uniform, suggestive use of the water sprayer—

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The floss isn't sex. It's guilt. It's tying you up for throwing away the I.N.S. notification granting Dominika her citizenship. She can move out, but she still doesn't know it, which means you're basically holding her prisoner. Tell her the truth, and leave me alone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: What? You startled me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We work together every day, usually under a fair amount of stress. It's only natural I'd pop into a subconscious thought every once in a while.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Have you ever dreamt about having sex with me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You paused.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, I didn't. You think I'm lying?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No, I think you're fighting the urge to snap the word "no" because your subconscious finds the idea abhorrent.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So if I snap, it's offensive, and if I don't snap, it's offensive for the exact same reason?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Talk to your subconscious.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This is becoming weird because you're making it weird.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: So you don't find the idea abhorrent?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I work with you. I don't have to answer that question.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: You just did. What happened?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Echo was negative, but he has severe abdominal pain.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Ultrasound didn't suggest any intestinal blockages, but he's severely constipated.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: No spores, clostridium, or organic toxins in the kitchen samples. Nothing in the bedroom either.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We need to scope him, and we're gonna need to clear his bowel first.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We should biopsy his thyroid.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: For an impacted bowel?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hashimoto's thyroiditis would explain his lung, heart, and intestinal involvement. And if you think we still need House's approval, it also explains dying in your sleep.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Nice call.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: When you invite me for dinner, I thought maybe you take me to a restaurant. Or have plates.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry. Idiot delivery guy forgot them.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Mm… The idiot delivery guy, or the idiot guy whose food you stole from lounge refrigerator, huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You've gotten to know me pretty well.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: My citizenship depends on it, right?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah… that's actually why I wanted to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: You heard news?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: So what news? They want us to come in for another interview?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Since we hadn't heard anything, I–I called, and they said it's gonna be a couple weeks, maybe a month till they finalize their decision.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: A month?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. It sucks.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: No, it's — it's not suck to live with you. It's been fun, but… you know, I just want to be legal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you will be. Absolutely. In the meantime…

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Have you ever shot anyone?

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: No, get away.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Look, this needle isn't nearly as big as the one in your arm, and that didn't hurt, did it?

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: I don't want it.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: They need to do it, Lue.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You'll only feel a little pinch as we give you the numbing medicine, and after that, you won't feel a thing.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Lue, calm down. It's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: What's he saying? What's the problem?

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: He's saying it's too late. There's nothing we can do. It's Hmong.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: He doesn't speak Hmong. He's never even heard it.

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: It isn't him speaking. It's the Dab.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's seizing!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Oh—! Oh, my God!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Need some Lorazepam in here!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Seizure rules out Hashimoto's.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, that's the issue, not that we have no rational explanation for how the patient spoke a language he's never even heard.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I've got one. Dang tong lee twah. It means "you're a bunch of pathetic idiots" in Hmong. Or it doesn't. But you wouldn't know because none of you speak Hmong. Kid, on the other hand, is presumably fluent in gibberish.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: The grandfather speaks Hmong. He translated.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He heard what he wanted to hear, 'cause if his grandson really is possessed, that means his son really is possessed, which is a giant step up from being a sledgehammering psychopath.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Whatever it was preceded a seizure. It's obviously a neurological symptom.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Scleroderma, advanced to the point that it's affecting his brain?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So we should start treating—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting that you keep falling for it when I say “interesting.” The scleroderma part was idiotic — we'd have seen skin involvement. The interesting part is that you and Park agree, but you're not able to look at each other.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Um… I'm looking at her.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I'm looking at him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good, now lick your lips.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Rasmussen's encephalitis. Diffuse spotty inflammation could hit the autonomic centers of the brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cha mo tie mia boo chang. It's Hmong for “get an MRI to confirm.”

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Rasmussen's encephalitis. But he'll be okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: With treatment, it's manageable. And it explains all the things that have happened to him?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We think so.

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: You are wrong. And you are wasting my grandson's time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Neurological issues can cause a person to speak in tongues, speak with an accent—

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: He wasn't speaking in tongues!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: In times of stress, our senses can fool us into believing—

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: I know the difference between science and faith, and when my son started having the same dreams my grandson is having, science couldn't help him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sorry if your son suffered from mental illness.

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: Kao was not crazy. He was bright, caring, happy, until the bad dreams came. I don't want to watch it happen again.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Please don't scare the boy. It won't help him get better.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Axial view of mid-brain level looks good. Moving on to thalamic.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: I had another dream last night. This time it was about you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: See, that's how you're supposed to react. When a woman tells you she's dreamt about you, you should be thrilled, even if you're not interested in her whatsoever.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're an idiot, you know that?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Well, I definitely won't be dreaming about you tonight.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm jealous of you two. You couldn't be more different, and yet you have this good thing happening. You support each other. You like each other. Don't let House screw it up.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: We're not that different.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, you are.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Apparently, there are some things about you I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I served one year in police unit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you're just telling your husband now?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Immigration doesn't know. No need for husband to know. What is happening to boy with demons?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Absence of evidence on an MRI, which my team has mistaken for evidence of absence.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: This is what I am not understanding: How can you believe in dark matters but not in dark spirits? Is–is the idea of demons so different than the Higgs boson? We can't see it, but we can see the impact of its presence. I borrowed your physics book. I read while in bathroom.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're a dead-eye shot and enjoy reading quantum physics on the crapper?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: I read in bathtub.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Better image. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: The doctors say my brain is sick.

utterance.speaker: Xang
utterance.content: Your doctors are trying their best, but they're not looking in the right place. You know, I know this is a lot to put on an eight-year-old, but you have angered our ancestors by ignoring them. Now do you remember how to talk to them? Yeah, that's right. Good. Now close your eyes, and we will ask for forgiveness together. You're doing good. But we have to do more. The evil spirits are in the air, and the only way to stop them is by stopping the air. You have to be brave. I'm not trying to hurt you. This will help you. I know it will.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lue? You okay?

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I can't wake him up!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lue! Lue, you're safe. You're in the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: Get grandpa away!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: He's not here, honey. It was just a dream.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: He was choking me!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No, Lue, it wasn't real.

utterance.speaker: Lue
utterance.content: It was! He grabbed my neck!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Those bruises weren't there before.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He had the dream, and then he had the bruising.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: More likely — and by “likely,” I mean “rationally” — it's the other way around. His brain felt the pain in his neck and created the dream to explain it.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Coagulopathy? Lung problems cause a clotting disturbance.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: He would have bruises everywhere.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is it really preposterous that dreams can have physical manifestations?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, short answer is—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Thoughts during sleep can and do cause physical changes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is that right, Dr. Park? Did you wake up this morning experiencing physical changes? It's medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Her dream doesn't mean anything. Can we start acting like it doesn't mean anything?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sure. We could also start acting like walls don't mean anything, but then we'd hurt our noses. You've been taking the high road. You haven't been teasing in an obviously teasable situation because you know it does mean something. She hates the dream because it makes her feel vulnerable. You love the dream because it makes you feel superior. The poor lass who can't help but fall sway to your charms, and you're bestowing upon her the gift of illusory irrelevance.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Can you please hint to House that you had a sex dream? I'd really prefer not to get distracted with trying to cure the patient today.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I refuse to divulge my dreams about girl-on-girl loofa action. The bruising could indicate anemia, a vitamin C deficiency, or even leukemia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That is so weird that you and I had the same dream. I assume yours also ends with me achieving ecstasy while simultaneously placing third in the New York City marathon.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Third?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm a realist. Liver failure can cause gibberish from encephalopathy, constipation, bruising, and breathing problems.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Hepatic fibrosis could hit someone his age.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So let's hit his liver. Get a biopsy.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Angle a bit more superiorly.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: He keeps having these nightmares that become real. They really hurt him. I don't want to believe that a nightmare can do that, but I—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm struggling with it too, but these things can be explained medically.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: But you haven't. Every doctor, every idea they've had, it's been wrong.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Liver biopsy's back. Team's about to meet.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Back to avoiding eye contact with me? House got to you again?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Want me to gaze longingly into your eyes as I tell you the test results?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I want you to treat me like a friend, which means getting over the fact that you like me more than I like you.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Yeah, egotism and preening really turn me on.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Too bad I'm not attracted to androgyny and self-pity, or you'd have it made.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Because anyone who hasn't gotten wet from your petri dish of STDs clearly has low self-esteem!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Bitch.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Dick!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why didn't your lips move when you said that?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Chase! You coming? Liver biopsy's back.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Biopsy was negative for fibrosis.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: So once again, you don't know what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It's always good to rule out the bad things.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Doctors!

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: God!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Was he…?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He was levitating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cool. So the one thing we know for sure is he was not levitating.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He was floating 6 inches off the bed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He could've just been arching his back off the bed.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, but then I would have come into the room and reported that the patient was weirdly arching his back off the bed. It was his whole body. He was levitating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So many questions… starting with why did Chase address his comment to someone who wasn't even in the room? Hocus pocus, on my feet you idiots must focus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Uh… uh… extreme… drained…

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The kid's not a magician.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Of course not. He's the lovely assistant. 'Cause grandpa pig sticker is waving the wand. Middling with… is Chase trying to avoid Taub, or is he trying to prove that he's not avoiding Park?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: We checked the bed. There were no platforms or wires. This wasn't a trick.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Tetanus could cause muscle rigidity. Maybe he was propped up by his heel and elbow.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Except he wasn't!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tetanus wouldn't cause that kind of breathing difficulty. And ending with… if Chase is trying not to avoid Park, why is he doing this today and not yesterday?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: But hypocalcemia could, and the enema we administered to cure his constipation had a high phosphorous load, which could make him transiently hypocalcemic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's a long shot, but at least it has the benefit of being rational. Go pump up his electrolytes and start beta-blockers. And good news for Park: I think Chase had a sex dream about you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Dreams don't mean anything.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I don't know. Nothing you've done has helped.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If we don't start and he has another seizure, the neurological damage could be permanent.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: My father-in-law — he thinks the calling ceremony didn't work because Lue wasn't there.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you think he's right?

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I don't know.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm sorry, but there's no way we can allow him to perform an exorcism in your son's hospital room.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Then I will have to take him home.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A day ago, you were insulted I'd even think you might believe that stuff, and now you're willing to stop all treatment, so you can try it?

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Maybe Xang was right about Kao. The man I loved wasn't evil and would never do what he did. He was… possessed. And my son needs his soul back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Why not? As long as he doesn't feed the kid anything or put anything on his skin that we haven't verified is harmless, what's the problem?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I agree. And since we're establishing a new policy of “What the hell, we'll try anything,” I'd like to hire Shakira to belly dance while singing Waka Waka.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: As long as you get the mom and Shakira to consent. It's no different than having a priest or rabbi lead a prayer vigil. The mom is scared and confused and desperate for anything that'll give her hope.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: True. But in the long run, I think you'll be happier having our lawyer declare her unfit. That way you won't be ratifying superstition over science, and I'll still be working here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And why would that make me happier? You're not going anywhere, and we're not “ratifying” their beliefs, we're respecting them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You do realize it may involve animal sacrifice. People who live in glass hospitals should not throw exorcisms.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll talk to the mother.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I don't want to deny him the medicine, I just… want to make sure I try everything I can.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I understand that, but you have to understand that we're a hospital, not a temple.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Then I'll take him elsewhere.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, you won't. He's sick. We can't let him leave here. I'm sorry, you really have no choice.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: I spoke to a lawyer. He told me as long as I wasn't saying no to your treatment, you couldn't say no to my religion.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give me 24 hours.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Мамо, це не має значення! Я маю право знати... Мамо, я повинна йти. Я подзвоню тобі пізніше. Цілую. Пока.

utterance.speaker: And it means
utterance.content: Mom, it doesn't matter! I have a right to know… Mom, I have to go. Kiss you. Bye.]

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: This came in the mail today!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I should've told you.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Told me what? I don't understand.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What's the letter?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: It's from my Uncle in Poland. My Aunt Luba, they put her in nursing home two months ago!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's too bad.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: My mother, I talk to her twice a week and she never even mentioned it. Wh–what does she think? That I can't handle? I am 29 years old! I am not a child! Were you going out tonight?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I could stay.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: He's still barely breathing.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Lue? How you feeling? Any stronger? Lue, can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I'm not sure. Lue, I need you to squeeze my hand. He's not responding. Get me an amp of D50!

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: You were wrong again? I'm calling his grandfather.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Genetic tests for Brugada and long QT variants came back negative.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about a carotid aneurysm? We should do an angiogram.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: He's got normal carotid pulses.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Who cares? Mom's given up, why shouldn't I?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sorry, do we not treat idiots? Because I thought—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Her kid levitated. That happens to my girl, I'm expanding my diagnostic horizons.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: All the more reason why we should shut down. We cure this kid now, crazy grandpa and his magic beads get all the credit.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: And since when do you care about credit?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Since when do I care about this kid? All I care about is sending mommy out into the world having faith in faith. Kid's better off dead. As soon as she's done appeasing the gods, let's talk.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about Kawasaki? It explains the irregular heartbeat, respiratory distress, and seizures.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It fits.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Which means he needs a coronary bypass.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It can't be Kawasaki. Echo would have shown it. But a patent ductus arteriosis—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It can't be a PDA. He's not an infant, nor has he had any symptoms for eight years.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe he has. Maybe he had an infected ductus, which we inadvertently treated with antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So no evidence is evidence of evidence?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm just saying, it's consistent.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: It's a billion-to-one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which means there's seven people in the world who fit the diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I thought we were looking for 100.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, maybe PDA is more common than we thought. With idiot doctors like you—

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You're wrong. But the treatment's just ibuprofen. Closes the malformed duct. Worst-case scenario, he just doesn't get better

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, worst-case scenario is you piss me off—

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're not gonna let us save an eight-year-old because one more person might embrace religion?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Does anyone here think my diagnosis is right? Well, then I have decided for today only, to respect your opinions. We will proceed according to your diagnosis and nothing else. That's an order. Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We need to put him on the O.R. schedule.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: His B.P.'s dropping.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's crashing. Call a code!

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: You need to stop this! I'm giving him the ibuprofen.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Dinner's almost ready.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think I'll stick with the fluids tonight, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Why are you sulking?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not sulking.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Ohhh, my mistake. Mmm.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Either religion is killing a kid, or I am. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Comforting my husband after a bad day. If this is not what you want, I go back to making dinner.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not gonna answer that.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: Oh, smart man. This is killing mood. U.S. citizenship!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'll get it.

utterance.speaker: Dominika
utterance.content: This is Mrs. House, please give good news, so my husband and I can go back to sex. Budmo! Is fantastic! How many notices you send me? O–okay, I–I–I… I–I come pick up naturalization certificate. Thank you for calling.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: ICU Nurse
utterance.content: Dr. Adams, Dr. Taub? His vitals are improving. He's stabilizing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: It worked.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: Um, no, it didn't. Mrs. Cheng, the medicine I administered was a long-shot treatment for Lue's heart, but that's what's helping him.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: Ibuprofen? That's for headaches.

utterance.speaker: Adams
utterance.content: I know it seems hard to believe, but it's true.

utterance.speaker: Lida
utterance.content: And I know this seems hard for you to believe. Honey… Grandpa was right. He saved you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There were two things we thought were impossible. One of them wasn't. That's all we know.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Was I good?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Doesn't mean anything. Idea got planted. It was probably inevitable.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: It means something.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Well, it could mean the obvious, that you want some of this.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: When will you learn that that look is insulting? Or it could just mean that we like each other. I'm weird, and you're pretty, but we connect. We feel safe. We trust each other.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: Park
utterance.content: Just testing my theory.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Adams defied me. There's one more zealot in the world. And Dominika moved out. She was fun. She was hot. She fixed my blender. That is not a metaphor. You know any good fake divorce lawyers? I am surprisingly depressed by this.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I have cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were a little short with me the other day. You do need an excuse. Cancer may be overplaying it.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Stage II thymoma. I didn't want to tell you until I had it confirmed. I got the tests back this morning. I have cancer, House.

utterance.speaker: Note
utterance.content: I don’t speak. If you do, we could use a transcription of Lue’s and House’s speeches. And thanks to our Ukranian reader who provided a transcript of Dominika’s speech.
